content.description: Sit Start on decent holds. Climb directly up the arete and top out.
content.location: This problem is located at VEB 81

content.description: As good as V0 gets. Step onto the lower rock and grab a little crimp. Reach straight up to a very good jug, walk your feet up, and go for the lip.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is on the right side of the Buddha Boulder, facing the approach.

content.description: Another good but short problem. Start with hands all the way to the right on the rail and move straight up to the slot just below the lip. Top out. Harder than it looks.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is on the back side of the Buddha Boulder.

content.description: Start low on good pockets and move up through more pockets to the biggest pocket on the wall. From there, you have 2 options: dyno to the edge directly above you, or use a very high left foot and lock-off to the same edge. Match, go for the top lip, get a high foot, and top out.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is 10-15 feet to the right of Kittie Corner and Croper Slimps.

content.description:
Start on the lowest good edge directly under the jagged crack. Move up on good ledges (avoid wet ones) until you can reach a big flake just under the roof on the left side of the crack. From there, make a big move to your right to a very obvious shelf behind you. Match there, traverse to the right, around the corner, and go up. Don't top out directly above the crack - that's cheating.

 Hint: using the big obvious shelf from before as a left hand unlocks the top out.
content.location: On the warmup boulder, directly to the right of Crowd Pleaser, under a very distinctly jagged crack feature.

content.description:
Start on the shelf underneath the right side of the cave. Work your way out to the right on crimps on both sides of the crack. Climb up the obvious ledges on the rock on the right. Find a foot on the left boulder and finish up through the crack. Start (green) and top out (red) pictured

 *BETA SPOILER* reach all the way over the right rock for a good hold to pull up on
content.location:
Just past the peak at Table Rock, keep going down the trail until you can see an alternate lower path. Keep following the lower trail in the same direction as the main trail until you come to a great looking overhang with a bench underneath it.

 This problem is located on the right side of the cave at an obvious crack

content.description: Start in good pockets on the left side of the crack. Work your way up the ledges on the left, then the right side of the crack. Start holds (green) and top out (red) in pictures
content.location:
Just past the peak at Table Rock, keep going down the trail until you can see an alternate lower path. Keep following the lower trail in the same direction as the main trail until you come to a great looking overhang with a bench underneath it.

 This problem is located on the left side of the cave at an obvious crack

content.description: Start sitting low on the arete and climb up using only arete holds. Move to the right at the top and top out.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is on the back side of the Buddha Boulder, on the obvious arete.

content.description: This route begins on the furthest side on a large ledge and moves from left to right (while facing the cliff) with feet on the left wall. the route then moves into the crack, down to a large jug, then a match on a large sloper. After that, the route moves across the inner facing of the cave on a number of crimpers and ledges. The route continues moving right to the point where the bottom becomes carved out. This section requires moving hands far off to the right while throwing a heel hook high to the left. Hands then move onto a thin crack/crimper ledge. Legs let go and swing off to the right where they sit on solid holds. This is the beginning of the crux section of the climb. The route continues right and then goes up on to the face of the cliff onto a number of pockets. The pockets run vertically up the cliff to a horizontal sloper section. The hardest part requires moving feet up while hands are in the deep sloper and then ends with a very difficult top out. -barrett1824 on 2010-05-13 rockclimbing.com
content.location: At The Cave

content.description: SDS with hands on a good shelf. Make a big horizontal move out to a good jug on the edge of the overhang. Move up and to the right for a fairly easy finish. Top out.
content.location: All the way on the left side of the Warmup Boulder, just before the last uphill to Table Rock. Most hikers pass under this overhang on the way up to table rock.

content.description:
Start low on good pockets and move up to the obvious crack. Continue left on the crack until you are at the arete. Climb up some hard layered slopers and crimps on the arete. The boulder to the left of the arete is off.

 There's a very tempting pocket on the face to the right, but resist the urge. That's part of Croper Slimps.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This is the first problem to the right of the largest crack.

content.description:
Start low on good pockets, just to the right of Seesaw's start. Reach out to good crimps on the lip and traverse right on more crimps and jugs until you start to turn around the corner. Keep traversing right until there's nowhere to go but up. Mantle.

 WARNING: there is a very tempting jug on the corner, but it is 100% breakable choss. Do not use this rock. Instead, use the jugs above it to work around the corner.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is all the way on the right side of the warmup boulder, just to the right of Seesaw.

content.description: Sit start from the left side of the rock. Follow the crack directly below the top and transition to the lower crack at the AVA. Cross over to the crack below the roof and goog around the arete unstill you can stand. It's a V1 if you follow this description mostly because of the length and a V2 if you use surface holds below the roof.
content.location: This problem is located at AVA Wall at Table Rock

content.description: A good, short problem. Start left hand on a sloper, right hand on a crimp. Pop up to a good right hold in the cut just below the lip. Top out.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is on the back side of the Buddha Boulder.

content.description: Stand start on a shelf on the right side of the cave, just under the overhang. Reach out around the overhanging arete for a couple good crimps. Move up and to the left on great pockets to some sloper ledges. From there, find good feet and use the crack/rail feature or a less-obvious right hand crimp to go for the ledge. Be sure to brush the top off before going for the finish - it will probably have pebbles and pine needles on it.
content.location:
Just past the peak at Table Rock, keep going down the trail until you can see an alternate lower path. Keep following the lower trail in the same direction as the main trail until you come to a great looking overhang with a bench underneath it.

 This problem is located on the right side of the cave.

content.description: One of the best climbs in the area. Start sitting with hands all the way on the right side of the rail. Traverse left and end on The Nail Arete.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is on the back side of the Buddha Boulder.

content.description: SDS with a good heel and move up to some good ledges. Once you get to the edge of the overhang, use a good pocket and sloper on your right to help move up to the top edge. The left lip is good.
content.protection: Pads, maybe a spotter for top out.
content.location: On the left arete of the Warmup Boulder, just before the last uphill to Table Rock. Most hikers pass under this overhang on the way up to Table Rock.

content.description:
Start low on good pockets. Move up to a good rail and over the lip to a strange but good pocket. Find good feet and reach up to the big obvious sloper rail, just under the moss in the picture. Go straight for the lip or use some small crimps in between.

 The arete will be tempting to use once on the sloper rail, but keep hands off!
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. The start holds are to the right of the large crack.

content.description: Start on good hands, grab the lip, traverse to the right, and top out after the lip runs out.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is on the left side of the Buddha Boulder, facing the trail.

content.description: Start sitting with hands in good pockets. Move up on good holds to the lip. Top out.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is on the left side of the Buddha Boulder, facing the trail.

content.description: Start with a left hand on a good edge and a right hand on a good crimp. Move up to a sloper and pop to the lip. Top out.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is on the left side of the Buddha Boulder, facing the trail.

content.description: Grab the two sloper "jugs" on the Buddha belly, get a foot up on the rock, and mantle up to the big shelf on the belly. Top out.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is on the front side of the Buddha Boulder, facing the trail.

content.description: One of the best climbs in the area. Start sitting with hands on the lowest shelf on the right side of the buddha boulder's overhang. Move up to a good pocket and go straight up to a sloper all the way onto the belly. From there, traverse left on slopers until you've matched on the two best ones on the belly (the start holds to Buddha Belly Stand). Get a foot up and walk up the belly.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is on the right side of the Buddha Boulder, facing the trail.

content.description: Start sitting on the lowest shelf, under the center of the Buddha Boulder's overhanging belly. Reach up for a good crimpy pinch at the lip, then keep moving up on crimps until you reach the sloper jug. Go for the other jug to your left (or don't), get a foot up, and walk up the belly.
content.location: Once the trail reaches the warmup boulders about 5-10 minutes from the trailhead at Hartwick, head to the right. This problem is on the front side of the Buddha Boulder, facing the trail.

content.description: Starts on the lower right arete of the wall. Move upward on good ledges and pockets and traverse left to the overhang's crack. Move up to a shelf just below the roof and reach out to a good jug on the left side of the crack at the end of the overhang. Keep reaching up on juggy ledges until you can reach a distinct horn-shaped block on the left, at the top. Match, find some feet that aren't chossy, and top out. Scary but worth it.
content.protection: Multiple pads and a spotter or two
content.location: Just past the peak at Table Rock, keep going down the trail until you can see an alternate lower path. Take a hard left down the trail, toward the direction you came from, and the AVA wall should soon be on your left.

content.description: Located directly behind the Hartwick College on the 1.5 mile Table Rock hiking loop. Table Rock is a great place to get a view of the entire city of Oneonta, NY. The climbing is very undeveloped, but there are many spots that could have boulder problems waiting to be discovered. The most developed spot is a 5-10 min walk along the loop but if you work your way back toward the entry you can find many highball overhangs and long traverses on fairly solid rock with smaller more accessible climbs scattered in. Many spots are very chossy so avoid areas that might be damaged by climbing. When you finish for the day make sure to visit Yellow Deli and be on the lookout for frisbees carrying its name and the promise of a free meal!
